text:
Google bought Fitbit for $ 2.1 billion
01 Nov 2019, 16:35 by Ilya Sidorov
Google said it bought Fitbit, a smartwatch and fitness watch maker, for $ 2.1 billion.
Buying Fitbit is an opportunity to invest even more in Wear OS, as well as introduce wearable devices under the Made by Google brand. Rick Osterlo, Google Vice President of Devices and Services
Under the terms of the deal, Fitbit will join Google and will not exist as a separate company.
Fitbit's health, fitness, and well-being data will not be used for Google advertising.
This purchase is very important for Google, as the company has long been trying to enter the smart watch market, but is constantly failing. Fitbit should help fix this.
Probably, in the future, the search engine will present its smart watch, which will be a direct competitor to the Apple Watch. [The Verge]
